metadata.name: Potential Excel.EXE DCOM Lateral Movement Via ActivateMicrosoftApp
metadata.comment: Detects suspicious child processes of Excel which could be an indicator of lateral movement leveraging the "ActivateMicrosoftApp" Excel DCOM object.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.parent_process.name), lower('\\excel.exe')) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('foxprow\.exe', 'schdplus\.exe', 'winproj\.exe')) AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\foxprow.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\schdplus.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\winproj.exe'))))

output.summary: Detects suspicious child processes of Excel which could be an indicator of lateral movement leveraging the "ActivateMicrosoftApp" Excel DCOM object.
